programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The celebratory launch of a new luxury resort is cut short when a woman is found electrocuted in her hotel bathtub - with the door locked from the inside. It looks like a simple case of suicide, but with Jack Mooney no longer around to confirm Commissioner Selwyns suspicions, DI Neville Parker is temporarily flown over from Manchester to close the case. However, he soon realises that island life is not for him, so when evidence of suspicious activity turns up, he is dismayed to realise he will have to extend his stay and investigate the case as murder.

The Docs decide to disguise themselves as various animals to get close to Lamput, only to be thwarted each time by the same animals they’re pretending to be, including a polar bear mother and her cub.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs run out of puff and decide to cut some corners. All it takes is a sharpie, as it happens; just change a wanted poster to offer a huge reward, and bingo! The public are gonna do your work for you. Weirdly quickly, a hard-boiled granny shows up with Lamput under her arm. Things turn ugly when she actually expects to be paid the reward. Most unreasonable. Not even an odd-jobs montage can pay this giant bill; the Docs get desperate and turn to crime, which works about as well for them as it usually does. Specs and Skinny end up in the clink, the granny pockets a heap of cash, and Lamput is yet again the one that got away.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders discover Zippy, an acrobatic flea, living on Sylvester’s back. They build Zippy a flea circus to try and convince him to relocate and relieve Sylvester’s itch.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird struggles to stop Poison Ivys diabolical schemes because he wants to be in the spotlight. But when he needs to use the bat-o-flage and become invisible, he’ll have to learn that doing good is its own reward.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Velmas got an interview at the prestigious Kingston University the most selective school in the country. The only catch? The dean wants her and the rest of the Scooby gang to figure out why the ghost of Elias Kingston the schools founder is haunting Kingstons book-filled halls!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: On a trip to Japan to visit Velmas friend, the gang comes face to face with the ancient crab monster, Kaniaku, and attempts to solve a 700 year-old mystery. Meanwhile, Daphne accidentally becomes a viral media sensation in Japan!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and Skinny spruce themselves up and head out to a piano concerto in the royal concert hall. Theyre on their best behavior, until they spot a fellow culture vulture who also happens to be small, orange and squishy. Honestly, theyre letting all sorts of rabble into these places these days. The Docs decide that a sleeping potion might be a quick and quiet way of capturing Lamput. Naturally things get out of hand, and when the entire audience catches a whiff of the snoozy brew, we find out exactly how hard it is to stay awake during a classical music recital. One star.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred gets a call for help from Chuck, his daredevil of a best friend, leading the gang on a rescue mission deep in the caverns of an ancient civilization.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Everyone seems to be going on holiday apart from Mr Bean, so he decides to recreate one at home!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants an ice cream from the ice cream van but ends up serving himself – along with every kid in town.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is feeling very left out when he discovers that Mrs Wicket is having a huge party downstairs and apparently he isn’t invited. Bean tries every trick in the book to sneak himself into the party – even resorting to hiding inside an enormous cake. If only he knew the real reason for the celebration.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean digs a hole in his garden - and finds a bomb!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidentally swaps trunks with a magician with magical results!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean doesn’t like sharing the local soft play centre with a load of rowdy kids – so he goes home and builds his own house of fun.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean’s pizzas are a huge success with everyone – well almost everyone.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is watering Mr Paliwal’s precious plant while he’s on holiday… what could possibly go wrong?!

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids engage in an epic battle to take the Kazoom fragment, which ultimately activates the volcano.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: When the ghost of a small towns founder returns to scare off mayoral candidates, the gang decides to run Velma as mayor to bait the ghost. They quickly discover, however, that Velma lacks the skillset to make her a popular politician!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang travels to Britain in 1843-ish and runs into Scrooge who claims he was attacked by the ghost of his partner Jacob Marley and that three more ghosts are coming. The gang agrees to solve the mystery but Velma wonders if she has more potential than just solving mysteries.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs prove their inventing skills by coming up with an age-altering time-ray. This breakthrough could change the world. If they used it for something other than chasing Lamput. Obsessed much, fellas? Wildly shooting their time-ray off in public causes a not-unsurprising amount of chaos, until the local law enforcement gets caught in the cross-fire. Looks like the Specs and Skinny are gonna be in jail till they get old the normal way.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Everyone seems to be going on holiday apart from Mr Bean, so he decides to recreate one at home!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Beans newspaper keeps getting stolen. Who is the cunning culprit?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to find a nice quiet place to read his book so he sets off for the Library. But instead of reading he becomes distracted by some funny online videos he sees on the Library’s computer. Before he knows it Mr Bean is recording his own video which is uploaded for everyone to see. Things start to go crazy when people check out his funny video and his popularity takes off. But does Mr Bean enjoy being in the public eye and how long will his celebrity last?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Sometimes Mr. Bean’s Teddy can be no fun at all. Feeling the need for a new friend, Bean buys a parrot. But getting the parrot past his landlady and her one-eyed cat, Scrapper, proves to be no easy task. Next, is trying to get the blasted bird to speak.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have found an Amerindian eagle amulet that endows he who wears it with the powers of a bird of prey.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy picks up the rangers new guitar and tries to win over his she-bear with the greatest rock concert in Nutty Hill history.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: To finally be on an equal footing with Grizzys imposing build and throw their own weight around in the cabin, the Lemmings decide to wear a blowup sumotori costume. Grizzy is roughly chucked out of the living room area. He decides to follow a special sumo diet to become the strongest guy around.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover an ancient Amerindian table with the power to show you past events.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover an old book of magic spells with a formula that enables one to take on the appearance of any other creature.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When Grizzy propels the Lemmings out of the log cabin perched on the Great Wall of China, the critters land on a small traditional house in a bamboo forest.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings love sesame nougat but Grizzy, who adores this treat too, steals their box. Quite upset, the rodents search for more, in vain.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwing and Goldie secretly decide to participate in the Gotham Air-Show, but when Batman needs their help, they must choose between winning the competition and their responsibilities to fight crime.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Grundy, a giant monster truck, causes chaos as he stomps around Gotham and creates a mess. / When MOE creates a new, super sparkly vehicle paint, the Batwheels decide to put on a talent show to see who will get a shiny new makeover!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: MOE creates a new, super sparkly vehicle paint!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: To ease the burden on MOE, the Batwheels use his duplicating machine to make copies of their repair bot, but the Batcave is soon overrun when the machine breaks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a giant water slide for Looneyburg’s waterpark.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: It’s Taz’s birthday, so The Looney Builders build him a huge ice cream sundae.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders race against the clock to build Cecil Turtle a new racetrack.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: George P. Mandrake hires The Looney Builders to build a T. Rex fossil.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Hildie and Beatie bring home a fortune-telling magic mirror. When it shows Tom a future he doesnt like, he tries everything to avoid it. In fact, everything that Tom does to avoid his future only seems to make it worse.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Spike comes to Tom and Jerry for help finding his missing bones. The detectives investigate a community garden, and it seems like their number-one suspect is an elusive gopher. It turns out that Tyke dug up all of his dads bones and was saving them as a birthday present for Spike.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby upgrades Bot to a Bot-y Guard. When Tom breaks in and sets off Bots defensive systems, things get out of control and Bot terrorizes the whole lab crew. Jerry and Napoleon must figure out how to disarm Bot without hurting him.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When the witches herb garden is destroyed, Tom sets a trap to capture the pest responsible. Quackers helps him but is unknowingly the pest Tom seeks to capture.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While playing ice hockey on Europa, an ice-covered moon of Jupiter, a stray puck hits Ella’s wrist and injures Maggie. Dad is sure he can fix her but will need palladium so he can fuse her fried circuits back together before she loses her memory.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy wants to watch an eclipse so badly that he makes special safety goggles for himself and his friends. But Ella has a different plan. When she insists on going to watch a binary star supernova, Slippy opts out and heads off on his own.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella always looks forward to Momella Day. And this Momella day promises to be the most interstellar yet, because they are going to see a small but powerful Red Dwarf star!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Priya has arrived from Earth to complete a school project about Mars. Priya is unfamiliar with the planet and a bit nervous about its huge dust storms. Ella, Slippy and Madhu convince her she needs to visit Mars to get the best video for her project.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Madhu has special presents for Ella and Slippy, to celebrate the anniversary of the day they met.But when Ella and Slippy say they can’t hang out, Madhu is sent off with only Maggie for company.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone is too busy to play with Toad so he foolishly opens the lock gates in order to propel his new boat. But this creates a giant wave that demolishes the Otters’ holt downstream. Toad must now repair their home, finding help from an unexpected quarter.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad installs a new Mauss security system to protect Toad Hall from the weasels, but Toads arrogance and rudeness towards Mauss leaves Toad locked out of Toad Hall for good. Only a big, mouse-sized apology can put things right.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad shows off his new hammock but refuses to let anyone else have a nap in it. The weasels trap Toad in the hammock, leaving Toad Hall wide open for them. Can Toad’s friends use the hammock to regain Toad Hall?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Many of the riverbank folk have their eyes on Toads ripe pears. Ratty offers to guard the pear tree all night, but in the morning all the pears are gone, thus mounting an investigation to find the culprit.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Rattys brother comes to visit, Ratty has to pretend that he lives in Toad Hall as he had claimed in his letters. Ratty persuades Toad to be butler, and his friends reluctantly go along with it.

programme.desc: The team triggers a possible water trap in the cave and are forced to stop digging. Martin Flagg believes the Story Rock indicates a tunnel behind a waterfall and the team brings in a Navy diver to explore the plunge pools and search for an entrance.

programme.desc: It’s one of the most infamous and unsolved mob murders--notorious mobster Bugsy Siegel is gunned down in his Beverly Hills living room. Bugsy Siegel made a lot of enemies across the country, but who killed him, and why?

programme.desc: Rising from the sands of the Egyptian desert is one of the ancient world’s greatest wonders--the mighty Sphinx. This mythological creature, with the head of a human and the body of a lion, looks like it’s standing guard at the great pyramids of Giza.

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: Two thieves dressed as fake cops make off with a half-billion dollars worth of world-class artwork from a Boston museum. Although the paintings are still missing, numerous suspects turn up dead.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick swings for the fences on some major league memorabilia from one of baseballs best. Corey and Chum go to the end of the road authenticating a Boyz II Men jacket. Chum is starstruck by some unique items from the golden age of Hollywood.

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: The team launches an incredible nighttime 200-drone light show experiment above the Triangle and the East Field, leading to a startling sighting in the sky and new data that points toward possible answers deep inside the mysterious Mesa.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: While the team continues to hunt down the legendary Chappell Vault in the Money Pit, new structures are uncovered in the mysterious swamp that strengthen a developing theory.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: All over the world, there are giant monoliths that our ancestors carved out of solid rock. What was the purpose of these monuments? Did they serve some kind of ritual function? Were they intended to honour the gods? Or designed to conduct energy?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick heads east to test a rare weapon from the 18th century. Back at the shop, Corey takes a swing at a Mickey Mantle rookie card. Then, military expert Alex brews something special for Ricks eyes only.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey bets it all on an original Triple Crown Trophy, lets see if he can win this horse race. Next the guys call in Rick Dale to save what might be one of the very first rides from Coney Island.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things get scary when a seller comes in with a letter from Stephen King. Will all work and no play make Corey a dull boy? Corey pays lip service to a Harrison family tradition when a James Bond poster comes in. Does he spy a deal?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For centuries archaeologists and explorers have been obsessed with locating ancient cities lost to time. How does a once-thriving community become a lost city? And if their ruins are found, what secrets might be they reveal about human history?

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.desc: Stalins gruesome trials to create a hybrid human-ape super army; the eerie reason East Germanys Stasi collected the scents of dissidents in airtight jars; how the CIA uncovered a secret Soviet island devoted to developing deadly bioweapons.

programme.desc: Chum gets groovy, baby in LA while checking out an iconic Austin Powers movie prop. Back at the shop, an Ancient Roman relic marches its way in. Then, Rick tries to make a super deal on an autographed sketch of one of Americas very first heroes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee is fired up to make a deal on one of Elon Musks most popular toys. Then, a limited-edition train set chugs its way into the shop. Later, a Yankees World Series ring is up to bat. Will Rick be able to make this steal?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: For years, cultures around the world have held a belief in stargates through which beings have traveled to Earth from distant points in the universe and even other dimensions. Could such portals truly exist?

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: When Kansas becomes a battleground in the national debate over slavery, settlers on both sides of the issue pour into the territory to determine its future as a free or slave state in its eventual admission to the Union.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down the top ten scariest encounters that just might be evidence of extraterrestrial visitation. From an encounter in rural Texas that left onlookers with unexplainable injuries, to mysterious cattle mutilations.

programme.title: The Unbelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: A million bats with tiny bombs strapped to their chests, inflatable tanks, robot assassins, bazooka Vespas, and war dolphins. These weapons, and others, pushed the boundaries of possible in the weirdest ways ever.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Ricks in the Big Apple to see if he can compute a deal on a rare piece of tech. Can this sweet piece tempt Rick or will he shut it down? A seller flies into the shop with a special edition Stan Lee Funko Pop. Will Corey make a super deal?

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island

programme.desc: For centuries, archaeologists have tried to unravel the mysteries of how - and why - certain incredible structures like the Great Pyramid at Giza, the staircase at Loretto Chapel, and Coral Castle were built. Will we ever find the answers?

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy walks into the bathroom and is horrified to find it clean! It’s not right for a Messy Monster at all. “Why do you have to clean things anyway?” He asks himself. And he goes to Okido to find out! When he arrives Felix and Zoe are at the top of their treehouse and there is a noisy racket going on! They don’t know what it could be so they skidoodle to go and have a look. When they arrive in the centre of Okido there are funny little things making lots of noise hurtling around the streets and sending the Okidinians into chaos!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a simple tune Cherry composes goes viral on the Berryweb, Cherry quickly gets fed up with everyone listening to this song, everywhere, all the time. She goes to comic lengths to get some peace so she can compose the song shes suppose to write for the Queen of Berryvania.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry receives a box of magic tricks for Christmas but is unable to create any magic.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is scared of going to the dentist, but when Trike complains that his horn is sore Harry insists that Trike goes to the Horntist in Dino World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-eyed penguin wanders into Hero’s kennel. The Junior Rangers head to New Zealand to find the penguin’s home, but can they prevent tourists from disturbing yellow-eyed penguins on the beach?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Bertie, Thomas and Spencer get into a debate about how many wheels is best. Bertie has four wheels, Thomas has six and Spencer is very proud of his twelve. But when Spencer breaks down while taking the Duke and Duchess to Callan Castle, Thomas must transport his passengers instead. Then Thomas finds the track blocked and Bertie takes over. And when Bertie has a flat tyre who should turn up, but the Thin Controller on his bicycle. Surely the Duke and Duchess can’t ride to Callan Castle on his bike! Luckily, the Thin Controller has a better idea about how to help.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: On match days Thomas is a very popular engine, because the Sodor football team wear blue. One match day a mainland team come to the island wearing red, and they cheer James because he is red too. Soon the two engines are competing with each other over who can bring the fans to the match faster. But by refusing to pick up supporters wearing the wrong colours, James ends up leaving the rival football team at the station since they are not yet wearing their kit and Thomas rushes right past the Fat Controller who is supposed to be the match referee. In all the confusion and delay there might not be a match at all!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Professor Smeraldo, in the middle of a pyramid exploration, calls Fume to have some information about Thudnose, a pharaoh who was nicknamed ""The Dragon Pharaoh"". Unfornutately, the video communication is not good and is quickly cut off. Grisù and Fume go to Egypt to give Smeraldo a hand. Unfortunately, they dont know how to get into the pyramid to meet him, so they have no other choice than find their way all by themselves, like Egyptologist. Grisu manages to use and decrypt the pharaohs secret motto. They finally find Smeraldo. Grisu helps him to overcome the final obstacle to eventually discover the marvelous sarcophagus of Thudnose!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu and Stella are wandering in the harbour eating an ice-cream. David arrives by car, he comes to see his friend Olivier, a sailor whose expedition has just fallen through. Olivier was supposed to go sailing and clear up the mystery of the “Mermaid pass” but his teammates have withdrawn at the last minute. Fortunately, Grisu can replace them.And here are Olivier and Grisu leaving on the planned expedition. But they didnt notice that Stella is also on board, locked in a closet in spite of herself.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Martis wants to leave, like his older brothers before him. Scoutbadger says he would like to go along too. The boys will find out that they are not yet quite big enough to play the adult.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Science and engineering hot shot Mei Moon has designed and built a rocket, named Stella. If successful Stella will become the smallest rocket ever to reach space. The Spring City Rockets have gathered and made a banner to celebrate and Bobs job is to finish building Stellas launch pad near the Observatory. Lofty is given the important task of lifting Stella onto the launch pad. Mei reminds him he has to be very careful, but he becomes flustered and tries to place the rocket before the launch pad is finished. Stella falls off and flops into wet concrete, ejecting her landing parachute, which Lofty accidentally runs over and rips. Now the launch is ruined. The team clean the concrete splattered rocket by using the machine wash back at the yard, but they still have the problem of the ripped parachute.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team have been busy building a new water park, “Spring City Splash” that includes a wave pool and splash zone. Now there is only one thing left to build... the double dragon water slide. Scoop loves dragons and cannot wait to help build the slides, but when he is asked to help build the support beams instead, he is less than impressed with his job. As Bob attaches the new water park entrance sign, Scoop digs foundations for the support beams. Suddenly Scoop becomes distracted with the arrival of the dragon slides and doesn’t finish the foundations. He attempts to see the dragon slides only to be sent back to finish his job. Now totally eager to get to the slides, Scoop rushes to complete his job and doesn’t realise that the support beams are not set and are beginning to lean.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids awesome sandcastle gets trampled overnight. A lone set of footprints along the beach leads to a prime suspect who claims not to have seen their sandcastle, yet hes carrying a big shell that once adorned it. As it turns out, no one touched their castle. The culprit was the rising waters of high tide. / /Huckle, Sally and Lowly discover the impossible – a set of ski tracks that run on either side of a tall tree.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A fun game of table tennis leads to the surprise discovery of a baby sea turtle and some sea turtle eggs! Can the Junior Rangers return the baby sea turtle and eggs to the beach while keeping them safe from hungry raccoons?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a greater mouse-deer back to its home in the rainforest. But can the Junior Rangers rescue the mouse-deer when it gets caught in an animal trap?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon challenges his brother to a whole bunch of sporting contests. Simon wins every time. Gaspard of course, finds the whole thing pretty unfair! It’s because Simon is bigger that he wins all the time! So Simon finally suggests a challenge where age doesn’t count: the first one to laugh loses! Against all odds, Simon loses. He finally realizes that you can’t win every time!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One spring day, Frank longhorn beetle visits his friend, Stanley. Frank suggests to organize a football match. Everyone wants to play football, the two teams get together quickly. The girls cheer on the sidelines. The game is about to start.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Easter is here. The girls: Dolly, Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr and Rosita gather and start to paint the Easter eggs. They happily work all day, painting beautiful eggs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night Berry is already in his bed, when he hears some strange noise. First he doesnt care, but the noise just getting louder. Finally he opens the door when the little green worm appeared. Long time no see friend just arrived.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One day Berry and Flutter played a board game. The first round was won by Berry, and the second one was won by him as well. In the third round, Flutter finished first. Berry got very angry. They played another round, but Flutter won again. Berry couldn’t help but made a scene.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Stanley and Balthazar ruin Flutters playing cards, but seeing the butterfly girls sadness, they ask Dollys help to make a brand new card deck.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda finds a bottle containing a treasure map in the stream. She excitedly shows Rupert her discovery and the two go on a treasure hunt. They turn Wild Rose Lane on its head, but theres no treasure to be found. After hours of searching in vain, the pair recover with a tasty picnic in Tildas garde, where Tilda finally decodes the complicated map.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tildas Great Great Aunt Emily is visiting Wild Rose Lane. Rupert suggests they have a competition to decide which of the two mice bakes the better cheesecake. While Emily sets to work in Ruperts kitchen, Tilda discovers an old recipe from her ancestor Eusebia which sounds better than her own.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna asks Rupert to look after her sons Billy and Benny. No problem, thinks Rupert. They can play while he reads a book. But no sooner has Rupert sat down in his armchair than the little squirrels turn up with one request after another. First they want lunch, then they need to go to the loo, then they want to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A Summer storm sweeps across the valley and a nervous Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends scamper into a cave with Big Nutbrown Hare. They are all safe and dry in the cave, but the thunder outside is still scary. Big Nutbrown Hare explains that noises can’t hurt you… but will he help them overcome their fears enough to enjoy the storm and the wonders of nature that it brings?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees have to assess each other as they do braking tests in the park. Wilson doesn’t do so well – and the trainees consider reporting that he did better than he actually did. In the end, Wilson decides they should be honest to Vee, even if it means forfeiting his badge – but Vee tells them the badge wasn’t for braking, but for good judgment, which they’ve shown by telling the truth!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah preparing her morning and setting up her portable radio, she later stumbles upon a little kitten with black-lined ears mewing and walking around aimlessly. Looking for its mother, Farah realizes the kitten is lost and calls for help. Back in the garden, Leo is finishing up a birdhouse before Katie joins him. Katie suggests and puts in some seeds. Instead of a bird, Hero runs in chasing a baby squirrel and the squirrel gets into the birdhouse while Hero barks excitedly. Leo receives a call from Farah who tells Leo and Katie about a lost kitten. The rangers head up to the treehouse to learn more about it before agreeing to help her find the kittens mother. Leo, Katie And Hero arrives and find Farah in the forest with the kitten, still mewing restlessly. The rangers conclude the kitten may be looking for its mum, the rangers embark on a journey to help find the mum. They want to leave the clearings to find the kitten’s mum, but the kitten finds the children threatening so it hides away inside a bush nearby. The ranger manage to climb the kitten by giving it a squeaking toy to calm it down.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle is nonchalantly playing with his boomerang in the Australian forest. But when it suddenly didnt came back, Kyle finds it behind a thick push. It turns out the boomerang has led him to a strange injured animal trapped inside a cage, accompanied with some blood and bandage in the cage. He felt worried so he calls in the Junior Ranger for help. Back in the garden, Hero finds a small branch with leaves and wanted to play fetch with Leo. Leo sees that theres an animal on the stick, to which Katie reveals that its a pupa and will transform into a butterfly. Then Leo receives a call where they later the animal is Pygmy Tarsier in the treehouse. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and ride PlatypusOne to meet up with Kyle. Once theyre there, they planned to help find the Pygmy Tarsier to a safe place for its to rest but Kyle opens up the cage as he was hypnotized by the animals eyes. The animal scrams away, causing the Rangers to go after it. The animal try to climb the tree but is unable because its hurt, and cant be approach by as it would trigger the animal to act hostile. Leo comes a plan and acts like a monkey to calm it down, to which it actually succeed.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This morning, T’choupi notices that the pretty drawing Lalou sent him through the mail has been chewed! But who’s the culprit?! Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi, Nina and Mom are busy sowing seeds in the small vegetable garden. But a bird keeps coming along and pecking them up as soon as they’ve been sown! So T’choupi and Nina decide to build a scarecrow to protect the seedbeds. They go about it in secret (although with Dad’s help) to give Mom a nice surprise. programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out playing in the forest, T’choupi and Nina come across a broken bird’s egg. Wooow! Look at that: a little chick has literally just been born! programme.title: Charley Goes To School

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In a bamboo forest, Kai is controlling his drone, Kaimera1000, to test the drones moves but gets startled when he sees a beetle on the hologram screen. Kai drops the drone, and they discover a giant panda paw print next to it. Felt curious, he plans to call the Junior Rangers. Back in the garden, Leo is relaxing while Katie draws. He asks Katie to pass him an apple but Katie ignores him and tell him to do it himself. Kai then contacts Leo through his wrist gadget, showing him the giant paw print he found. Leo and Katie go to the treehouse and use the computer to confirm that the paw print belongs to a giant panda. They learn about giant pandas characteristics, such as their black and white fur and their status as a national treasure in China. They discover that giant pandas used to be critically endangered but are now less threatened due to conservation efforts. Leo contacts Kai again, and they decide to find and study the giant panda. Leo, Katie, and Hero, their dog, get ready and embark on their mission and meet at Kais location. The Junior Rangers meet up with Kai and they try to find the panda, thanks to Kais drone. They then meet up a Giant Panda who is eating some bamboos. Kai try to capture pictures but then Hero suddenly barks at it. The children then see a Panda cub starts following Hero. It tries to playfully wrestle with Hero. Hero isnt amused as the panda cub keeps bothering him. Hero then gets annoyed and runs away, causing the panda cub to choose over Hero then its mother. The mother panda realizes its cub is missing and starts bleating a sound.
